titleStmt.title: A vvatch-vvoord to Englande to beware of traytours and tretcherous practises, which haue beene the ouerthrowe of many famous kingdomes and common weales. Written by a faithfull affected freend to his country: who desireth God long to blesse it from traytours, and their secret conspiracyes. Séene and allowed, according to the order appointed in the Quéenes iniunctions.
titleStmt.author: Munday, Anthony, 1553-1633.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed [by John Charlewood] for Thomas Hacket, and are to be solde at his shop in Lumberd streete, vnder the signe of the Popes head,

notesStmt.note: Dedication signed: A.M., i.e. Anthony Munday.
The first leaf is blank except for signature-mark "A.j."; the last leaf is blank.
In this edition B1r line 2 of heading has "England". Only quires B-N are a different setting from STC 18282a.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.

place.placeName: his shop in Lumberd streete, vnder the signe of the Popes head
